Pre-Game Insights: This isn't a must-win game for either team, but Australia will be on wafer-thin ice if they lose.
A washout would suit India just fine, sealing their semi-finals spot, but for Australia the difference between two points and one could be humongous.
India have a 3-2 edge over Australia in their T20 World Cup meetings so far.
Virat Kohli (4103) and Rohit Sharma (4073) are separated by just 30 runs on top of India's run-scoring leaderboard in T20Is.
If they both feature, Agar and Arshdeep will play their 50th T20Is. Agar made his T20I debut in March 2016, while Arshdeep made his in July 2022.
Offspinners have bowled effectively to them in the powerplay so far at this World Cup, with Mohammad Nabi and Mahedi Hasan getting through quiet overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: St Lucia has been the most batting-friendly venue of this T20 World Cup in terms of both scoring rate (8.92) and average (28.76).
There is a good chance of rain in St Lucia, though, with forecasts predicting showers through Monday morning with the weather clearing up roughly between 10am and 4pm.
